intro: Canthium suaveolens, commonly known as sweet-smelling canthium, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are usually hairy. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with white petals and yellow stamens, which are often fragrant. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that split open to release seeds. Canthium suaveolens is typically found in moist, shaded habitats in tropical regions.
